1523        /**
1524         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1525         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1526         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1527         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1528         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1529         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1530         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1531         *
1532         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1533         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1534         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1535         */
1536        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1537            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
1538        }

1540        /**
1541         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1542         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1543         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1544         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1545         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1546         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1547         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
1548         *
1549         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1550         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1551         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1552         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1553         */
1554        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
1555            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, octaveMultiplier);
1556        }

1559         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1560         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1561         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1562         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1563         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1564         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1565         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1566         *
1567         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1568         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

1570         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1571         */

1576        /**
1577         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1578         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1579         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1580         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
1581         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
1582         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
1583         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
1584         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
1585         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
1586         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
1587         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
1588         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
1589         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
1590         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
1591         * that don't require zooming.
1592         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1593         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1594         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1595         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
1596         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1597         */
1598        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
1599            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
1600            xPositions = new double[width][height];
1601            yPositions = new double[width][height];
1602            zPositions = new double[width][height];
1603
1604            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
1605            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
1606            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
1607            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
1608            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
1609        }
1610        @Override
1611        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
1612            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1613        }
1614
1615        /**
1616         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
1617         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
1618         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
1619         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
1620         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
1621         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
1622         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
1623         * @param latitude the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
1624         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
1625         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
1626         */
1627        @Override
1628        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
1629            int x = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * 0.15915494309189535 * width + 0.5),
1630                    y = (int)((NumberTools.sin(latitude) * 0.5 + 0.5) * height + 0.5);
1631            return Coord.get(
1632                    wrapX(x, y),
1633                    wrapY(x, y));
1634        }
1635
1636        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
1637                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
1638        {
1639            boolean fresh = false;
1640            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
1641            {
1642                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1643                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1644                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1645                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1646                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1647                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1648                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1649                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1650                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1651                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1652                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1653                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1654                cacheA = stateA;
1655                cacheB = stateB;
1656                fresh = true;
1657            }
1658            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
1659            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
1660            int t;
1661
1662            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
1663            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
1664
1665            double p,
1666                    ps, pc,
1667                    qs, qc,
1668                    h, temp,
1669                    i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 2.0 / (height+2.0),//(3.141592653589793) / (height+2.0),
1670                    xPos = startX, yPos, i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h / (height+2.0);
1671            final double[] trigTable = new double[width << 1];
1672            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
1673                p = xPos * i_w + centerLongitude;
1674                trigTable[x<<1]   = NumberTools.sin(p);
1675                trigTable[x<<1|1] = NumberTools.cos(p);
1676            }
1677            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1678            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1679                qs = -1 + yPos;//-1.5707963267948966 + yPos;
1680                qc = NumberTools.cos(NumberTools.asin(qs));
1681                //qs = qs;
1682                //qs = NumberTools.sin(qs);
1683                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++) {
1684                    ps = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.sin(p);
1685                    pc = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.cos(p);
1686                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
1687                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
1688                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
1689                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
1690                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
1691                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
1692                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
1693                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
1694                            , qs, seedB));
1695                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
1696                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
1697                            , seedC));
1698
1699                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
1700                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
1701                    if(fresh) {
1702                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
1703                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
1704
1705                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
1706                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
1707
1708                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
1709                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
1710                    }
1711                }
1712                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
1713                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
1714
1715            }
1716            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
1717                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
1718                    hMod;
1719            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1720            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1721            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1722
1723            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1724                temp = Math.abs(yPos - 1.0);
1725                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
1726                temp = 2.2 - temp;
1727                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1728//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
1729//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
1730//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
1731                    h = heightData[x][y];
1732                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
1733                    hMod = 1.0;
1734                    switch (t) {
1735                        case 0:
1736                        case 1:
1737                        case 2:
1738                        case 3:
1739                            h = 0.4;
1740                            hMod = 0.2;
1741                            break;
1742                        case 6:
1743                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
1744                            break;
1745                        case 7:
1746                            h *= -0.25;
1747                            break;
1748                        case 8:
1749                            h *= -0.4;
1750                            break;
1751                        default:
1752                            h *= 0.05;
1753                    }
1754                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
1755                    if (fresh) {
1756                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
1757                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
1758                    }
1759                }
1760            }
1761            if(fresh)
1762            {
1763                minHeat1 = ps;
1764                maxHeat1 = pc;
1765            }
1766            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
1767            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1768            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1769            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1770            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1771
1772
1773            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1774                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1775                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
1776                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
1777                    if (fresh) {
1778                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
1779                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
1780                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
1781                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
1782                    }
1783                }
1784            }
1785            if(fresh)
1786            {
1787                minHeat = qs;
1788                maxHeat = qc;
1789                minWet = ps;
1790                maxWet = pc;
1791            }
1792            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
1793            /*
1794            if(generateRivers) {
1795                if (fresh) {
1796                    addRivers();
1797                    riverData.connect8way().thin().thin();
1798                    lakeData.connect8way().thin();
1799                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1800                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1801                } else {
1802                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1803                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1804                    int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 2), 0), width),
1805                            sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 2), 0), height);
1806                    for (int i = 1; i <= zoom; i++) {
1807                        int stx2 = (startCacheX.get(i) - startCacheX.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1),
1808                                sty2 = (startCacheY.get(i) - startCacheY.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1);
1809                        //(zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 1 + zoom), (zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 1 + zoom)
1810
1811//                        Map is 200x100, GreasedRegions have that size too.
1812//                        Zoom 0 only allows 100,50 as the center, 0,0 as the corner

1838    /**
1839     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
1840     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
1841     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mollweide_projection">Mollweide projection</a>.
1842     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/BBKrKjI.png" >Example map, showing ellipse shape</a>
1843     */
1844    @Beta
1845    public static class EllipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1846        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1847        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1848        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1849                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1850                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1851
1852        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1853        public final double[][] xPositions,
1854                yPositions,
1855                zPositions;
1856        protected final int[] edges;

1859        /**
1860         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1861         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1862         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
1863         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1864         * If you were using {@link EllipticalMap#EllipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1865         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.
1866         */
1867        public EllipticalMap() {
1868            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
1869        }

1872         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1873         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1874         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1875         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1876         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1877         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1878         *
1879         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1880         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1881         */
1882        public EllipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1883            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  FastNoise.instance,1.0);
1884        }

1887         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1888         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1889         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1890         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1891         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1892         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1893         *
1894         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1895         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1896         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1897         */
1898        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1899            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);

1902        /**
1903         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1904         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1905         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1906         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1907         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1908         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
1909         *
1910         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1911         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1912         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1913         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1914         */
1915        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
1916            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, octaveMultiplier);
1917        }

1919        /**
1920         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1921         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1922         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1923         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1924         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1925         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
1926         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
1927         *
1928         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1929         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1930         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1931         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1932         */
1933        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
1934            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
1935        }
1936
1937        /**
1938         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1939         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1940         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
1941         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
1942         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
1943         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
1944         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
1945         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
1946         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
1947         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
1948         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
1949         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
1950         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
1951         * that don't require zooming.
1952         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1953         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1954         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1955         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1956         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1957         */
1958        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
1959            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
1960            xPositions = new double[width][height];
1961            yPositions = new double[width][height];
1962            zPositions = new double[width][height];
1963            edges = new int[height << 1];
1964            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
1965            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
1966            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
1967            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
1968            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
1969        }
1970
1971        @Override
1972        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
1973            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1974            if(x < edges[y << 1])
1975                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
1976            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
1977                return edges[y << 1];
1978            else return x;
1979        }
1980
1981        @Override
1982        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
1983            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1984        }
1985
1986        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
1987                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
1988        {
1989            boolean fresh = false;
1990            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
1991            {
1992                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1993                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1994                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1995                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1996                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1997                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1998                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1999                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2000                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2001                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2002                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2003                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2004                cacheA = stateA;
2005                cacheB = stateB;
2006                fresh = true;
2007            }
2008            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2009            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2010            int t;
2011
2012            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2013            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2014
2015            double p,
2016                    ps, pc,
2017                    qs, qc,
2018                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2019                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2020                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2021                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2022                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2023                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2024
2025            yPos = startY - ry;
2026            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2027                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2028                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2029                thy = thx * 2.0;
2030                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2031
2032                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2033                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2034
2035                boolean inSpace = true;
2036                xPos = startX;
2037                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2038                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2039                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2040                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2041                        inSpace = true;
2042                        continue;
2043                    }
2044                    if(inSpace)
2045                    {
2046                        inSpace = false;
2047                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2048                    }
2049                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2050                    th += centerLongitude;
2051                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2052                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2053                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2054                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2055                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2056                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2057                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2058                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2059                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2060                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2061                            , qs, seedB));
2062                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2063                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2064                            , seedC));
2065                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2066                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2067                    if(fresh) {
2068                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2069                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2070
2071                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2072                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2073
2074                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2075                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2076                    }
2077                }
2078                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2079                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2080
2081            }
2082            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2083                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2084                    hMod,
2085                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2086            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2087            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2088            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2089
2090            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2091                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2092                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2093                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2094                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2095                    h = heightData[x][y];
2096                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2097                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2098                        continue;
2099                    }
2100                    else
2101                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2102                    hMod = 1.0;
2103                    switch (t) {
2104                        case 0:
2105                        case 1:
2106                        case 2:
2107                        case 3:
2108                            h = 0.4;
2109                            hMod = 0.2;
2110                            break;
2111                        case 6:
2112                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2113                            break;
2114                        case 7:
2115                            h *= -0.25;
2116                            break;
2117                        case 8:
2118                            h *= -0.4;
2119                            break;
2120                        default:
2121                            h *= 0.05;
2122                    }
2123                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2124                    if (fresh) {
2125                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2126                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2127                    }
2128                }
2129            }
2130            if(fresh)
2131            {
2132                minHeat1 = ps;
2133                maxHeat1 = pc;
2134            }
2135            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2136            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2137            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2138            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2139            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2140
2141
2142            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2143                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2144                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2145                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2146                    if (fresh) {
2147                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2148                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2149                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2150                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2151                    }
2152                }
2153            }
2154            if(fresh)
2155            {
2156                minHeat = qs;
2157                maxHeat = qc;
2158                minWet = ps;
2159                maxWet = pc;
2160            }
2161            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2162        }
2163    }

2165    /**
2166     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing map (such as a map of Earth, which it can do by default). It
2167     * uses the Mollweide projection (an elliptical map projection, the same as what EllipticalMap uses) for both its
2168     * input and output; <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/MimicWorld.png">an example can be seen here</a>,
2169     * imitating Earth using a 512x256 world map as a GreasedRegion for input.
2170     */
2171    public static class MimicMap extends EllipticalMap
2172    {
2173        public GreasedRegion earth;
2174        public GreasedRegion shallow;
2175        public GreasedRegion coast;
2176        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
2177        /**
2178         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Earth using an elliptical projection
2179         * (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2180         * Always makes a 512x256 map.
2181         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2182         * If you were using {@link MimicMap#MimicMap(long, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2183         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.
2184         */
2185        public MimicMap() {
2186            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
2187                    , FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
2188        }

2190        /**
2191         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2192         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2193         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
2194         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2195         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.

2198         */
2199        public MimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {

2203        /**
2204         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2205         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2206         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
2207         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2208         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2209         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2210         *

2220         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2221         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
2222         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
2223         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2224         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2225         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2226         *
2227         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2228         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2229         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal

2234
2235        /**
2236         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2237         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2238         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
2239         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
2240         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
2241         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
2242         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
2243         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
2244         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
2245         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2246         *
2247         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2248         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2249         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2250         */
2251        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2252            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2253        }

2255        /**
2256         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2257         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2258         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
2259         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
2260         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
2261         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2262         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2263         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2264         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2265         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2266         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2267         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2268         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2269         * that don't require zooming.
2270         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2271         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2272         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2273         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2274         */
2275        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2276            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
2277            earth = toMimic;
2278            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
2279            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
2280            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
2281        }

2298        /**
2299         * Meant for making maps conform to the Mollweide (elliptical) projection that MimicMap uses.
2300         * @param rectangular A GreasedRegion where "on" represents land and "off" water, using any rectangular projection
2301         * @return a reprojected version of {@code rectangular} that uses an elliptical projection
2302         */
2303        public static GreasedRegion reprojectToElliptical(GreasedRegion rectangular) {
2304            int width = rectangular.width, height = rectangular.height;
2305            GreasedRegion t = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
2306            double yPos, xPos,
2307                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2308                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2309                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2310    
2311            yPos = -ry;
2312            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos++) {
2313                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2314                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2315                thy = thx * 2.0;
2316                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2317                xPos = 0;
2318                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos++) {
2319                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2320                    if (th >= -3.141592653589793 && th <= 3.141592653589793
2321                            && rectangular.contains((int) ((th + 1) * hw), (int) ((lat + 1) * ry))) {
2322                        t.insert(x, y);
2323                    }
2324                }
2325            }
2326            return t;
2327        }

2329        @Override
2330        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2331            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2332            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2333                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2334            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2335                return edges[y << 1];
2336            else return x;
2337        }
2338
2339        @Override
2340        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2341            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2342        }

2344        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2345                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2346        {
2347            boolean fresh = false;
2348            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2349            {
2350                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2351                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2352                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2353                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2354                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2355                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2356                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2357                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2358                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2359                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2360                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2361                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2362                cacheA = stateA;
2363                cacheB = stateB;
2364                fresh = true;
2365            }
2366            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2367            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2368            int t;
2369
2370            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
2371            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2372
2373            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
2374
2375            if(zoom > 0)
2376            {
2377                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
2378                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
2379                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
2380                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
2381                }
2382                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2383                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2384            }
2385            else
2386            {
2387                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
2388                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
2389            }
2390            double p,
2391                    ps, pc,
2392                    qs, qc,
2393                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2394                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2395                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2396                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
2397                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2398                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2399            yPos = startY - ry;
2400            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2401
2402                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2403                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2404                thy = thx * 2.0;
2405                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2406
2407                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2408                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2409
2410                boolean inSpace = true;
2411                xPos = startX;
2412                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2413                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2414                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2415                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2416                        inSpace = true;
2417                        continue;
2418                    }
2419                    if(inSpace)
2420                    {
2421                        inSpace = false;
2422                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2423                    }
2424                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2425//                    th += centerLongitude;
2426                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2427                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2428                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2429                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2430                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2431                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
2432                    {
2433                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2434                                ps, qs, seedA)) * 0.85;
2435                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
2436                            h += 0.05;
2437                        else
2438                            h += 0.15;
2439                    }
2440                    else
2441                    {
2442                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2443                                ps, qs, seedA)) * -0.9;
2444                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
2445                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
2446                        else
2447                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
2448                    }
2449                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
2450                    heightData[x][y] = h;
2451                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2452                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2453                            , qs, seedB));
2454                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2455                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2456                            , seedC));
2457                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2458                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2459                    if(fresh) {
2460                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2461                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2462
2463                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2464                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2465
2466                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2467                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2468                    }
2469                }
2470                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2471                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2472
2473            }
2474            double heightDiff = 2.0 / (maxHeightActual - minHeightActual),
2475                    heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2476                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2477                    hMod,
2478                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / (halfHeight);
2479            double minHeightActual0 = minHeightActual;
2480            double maxHeightActual0 = maxHeightActual;
2481            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2482            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2483            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2484
2485            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2486                temp = Math.pow(Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half, 1.5);
2487                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2488                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2489                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2490//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
2491//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
2492//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
2493                    h = heightData[x][y];
2494                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2495                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2496                        continue;
2497                    }
2498                    else
2499                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2500                    hMod = 1.0;
2501                    switch (t) {
2502                        case 0:
2503                        case 1:
2504                        case 2:
2505                        case 3:
2506                            h = 0.4;
2507                            hMod = 0.2;
2508                            break;
2509                        case 6:
2510                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2511                            break;
2512                        case 7:
2513                            h *= -0.25;
2514                            break;
2515                        case 8:
2516                            h *= -0.4;
2517                            break;
2518                        default:
2519                            h *= 0.05;
2520                    }
2521                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2522                    if (fresh) {
2523                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2524                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2525                    }
2526                }
2527            }
2528            if(fresh)
2529            {
2530                minHeat1 = ps;
2531                maxHeat1 = pc;
2532            }
2533            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2534            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2535            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2536            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2537            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2538
2539
2540            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2541                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2542                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2543                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2544                    if (fresh) {
2545                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2546                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2547                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2548                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2549                    }
2550                }
2551            }
2552            if(fresh)
2553            {
2554                minHeat = qs;
2555                maxHeat = qc;
2556                minWet = ps;
2557                maxWet = pc;
2558            }
2559            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2560        }
2561
2562    }
2563    /**
2564     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
2565     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). This uses an
2566     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
2567     * the latitude always at the equator.
2568     * <a href="https://tommyettinger.github.io/DorpBorx/worlds7/index.html">Example views of 50 planets</a>.
2569     */
2570    @Beta
2571    public static class SpaceViewMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
2572        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
2573        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
2574        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2575                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2576                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2577
2578        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
2579        public final double[][] xPositions,
2580                yPositions,
2581                zPositions;
2582        protected final int[] edges;
2583
2584        /**
2585         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2586         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2587         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
2588         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2589         * If you were using {@link SpaceViewMap#SpaceViewMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2590         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.
2591         */
2592        public SpaceViewMap() {
2593            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
2594        }

2596        /**
2597         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2598         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2599         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
2600         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
2601         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2602         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2603         *
2604         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2605         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2606         */
2607        public SpaceViewMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2608            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  FastNoise.instance,1.0);
2609        }
2610
2611        /**
2612         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2613         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2614         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2615         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2616         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2617         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2618         *
2619         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2620         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2621         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2622         */
2623        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2624            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
2625        }
2626
2627        /**
2628         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2629         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2630         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2631         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2632         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2633         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2634         *
2635         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2636         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2637         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2638         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2639         */
2640        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2641            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, octaveMultiplier);
2642        }
2643
2644        /**
2645         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2646         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2647         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2648         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2649         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2650         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2651         *
2652         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2653         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2654         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2655         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2656         */
2657        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2658            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2659        }
2660
2661        /**
2662         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2663         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2664         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
2665         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
2666         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2667         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2668         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2669         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2670         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2671         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2672         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2673         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2674         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2675         * that don't require zooming.
2676         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2677         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2678         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2679         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2680         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2681         */
2682        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2683            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2684            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2685            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2686            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2687            edges = new int[height << 1];
2688            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
2689            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325, 0.475);
2690//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
2691//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25, 0.475);
2692            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
2693            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
2694            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
2695        }
2696
2697        @Override
2698        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
2699            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2700            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
2701        }
2702
2703        @Override
2704        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2705            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2706        }
2707
2708        //private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0), inverseRoot2 = 1.0 / root2, halfInverseRoot2 = 0.5 / root2;
2709
2710        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2711                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2712        {
2713            boolean fresh = false;
2714            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2715            {
2716                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2717                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2718                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2719                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2720                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2721                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2722                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2723                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2724                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2725                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2726                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2727                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2728                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2729                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2730                cacheA = stateA;
2731                cacheB = stateB;
2732                fresh = true;
2733            }
2734            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2735            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2736            int t;
2737
2738            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2739            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2740
2741            double p,
2742                    ps, pc,
2743                    qs, qc,
2744                    h, temp, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
2745                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2746                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2747                    th, lon, lat, rho,
2748                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
2749                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
2750
2751            yPos = startY - ry;
2752            iyPos = yPos / ry;
2753            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
2754
2755                boolean inSpace = true;
2756                xPos = startX - rx;
2757                ixPos = xPos / rx;
2758                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
2759                    rho = Math.sqrt(ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
2760                    if(rho > 1.0) {
2761                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2762                        inSpace = true;
2763                        continue;
2764                    }
2765                    if(inSpace)
2766                    {
2767                        inSpace = false;
2768                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2769                    }
2770                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2771                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
2772                    lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
2773                    lon = centerLongitude + NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th));
2774
2775                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2776                    qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2777
2778                    pc = NumberTools.cos(lon) * qc;
2779                    ps = NumberTools.sin(lon) * qc;
2780
2781                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2782                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2783                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2784                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2785                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2786                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2787//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrain4D.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,
2788//                            (terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA)
2789//                                    + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC - seedB)) * 0.5,
2790//                            seedA) * landModifier);
2791                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2792                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2793                            , qs, seedB));
2794                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2795                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2796                            , seedC));
2797                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2798                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2799                    if(fresh) {
2800                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2801                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2802
2803                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2804                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2805
2806                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2807                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2808                    }
2809                }
2810                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2811                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2812
2813            }
2814            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2815                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2816                    hMod,
2817                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2818            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2819            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2820            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2821
2822            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2823                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2824                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2825                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2826                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2827                    h = heightData[x][y];
2828                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2829                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2830                        continue;
2831                    }
2832                    else
2833                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2834                    hMod = 1.0;
2835                    switch (t) {
2836                        case 0:
2837                        case 1:
2838                        case 2:
2839                        case 3:
2840                            h = 0.4;
2841                            hMod = 0.2;
2842                            break;
2843                        case 6:
2844                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2845                            break;
2846                        case 7:
2847                            h *= -0.25;
2848                            break;
2849                        case 8:
2850                            h *= -0.4;
2851                            break;
2852                        default:
2853                            h *= 0.05;
2854                    }
2855                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2856                    if (fresh) {
2857                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2858                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2859                    }
2860                }
2861            }
2862            if(fresh)
2863            {
2864                minHeat1 = ps;
2865                maxHeat1 = pc;
2866            }
2867            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2868            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2869            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2870            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2871            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2872
2873
2874            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2875                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2876                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2877                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2878                    if (fresh) {
2879                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2880                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2881                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2882                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2883                    }
2884                }
2885            }
2886            if(fresh)
2887            {
2888                minHeat = qs;
2889                maxHeat = qc;
2890                minWet = ps;
2891                maxWet = pc;
2892            }
2893            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2894        }
2895    }
2896    /**
2897     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape with a flat top
2898     * and bottom but near-circular sides. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
2899     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
2900     * distortion on the far left and far right edges of the map than EllipticalMap, but the flat top and bottom are
2901     * probably very distorted in a small area near the poles.
2902     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eckert_IV_projection">Eckert IV projection</a>.
2903     * <a href="https://squidpony.github.io/SquidLib/RoundSideWorldMap.png">Example map</a>
2904     */
2905    @Beta
2906    public static class RoundSideMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
2907        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
2908        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
2909        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2910                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2911                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2912
2913        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
2914        public final double[][] xPositions,
2915                yPositions,
2916                zPositions;
2917        protected final int[] edges;
2918
2919
2920        /**

2985         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2986         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
2987         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}
2988         *
2989         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2990         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
