2992         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}

2998        /**
2999         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3000         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3001         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3002         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3003         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3004         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3005         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3006         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3007         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3008         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3009         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3010         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3011         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3012         * that don't require zooming.
3013         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3014         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3015         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3016         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3017         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3018         */
3019        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3020            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3021            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3022            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3023            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3024            edges = new int[height << 1];
3025            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3026            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3027//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
3028//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
3029            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3030            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3031            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3032        }
3033
3034        @Override
3035        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3036            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3037            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3038                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3039            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3040                return edges[y << 1];
3041            else return x;
3042        }
3043
3044        @Override
3045        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3046            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3047        }
3048
3049        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3050                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3051        {
3052            boolean fresh = false;
3053            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3054            {
3055                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3056                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3057                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3058                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3059                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3060                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3061                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3062                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3063                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3064                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3065                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3066                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3067                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3068                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3069                cacheA = stateA;
3070                cacheB = stateB;
3071                fresh = true;
3072            }
3073            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3074            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3075            int t;
3076
3077            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3078            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3079
3080            double p,
3081                    ps, pc,
3082                    qs, qc,
3083                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3084                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3085                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3086                    th, thb, thx, thy, lon, lat,
3087                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.326500428177002 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3088                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3089
3090            yPos = startY - ry;
3091            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3092                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3093                thb = NumberTools.asin(thy);
3094                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3095                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3096                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3097                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3098                lat = NumberTools.asin(qs);
3099
3100                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3101
3102                boolean inSpace = true;
3103                xPos = startX - hw;
3104                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3105                    th = lon * xPos;
3106                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3107                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3108                        inSpace = true;
3109                        continue;
3110                    }
3111                    if(inSpace)
3112                    {
3113                        inSpace = false;
3114                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3115                    }
3116                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3117                    th += centerLongitude;
3118                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3119                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3120                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3121                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3122                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3123                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3124                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3125                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3126                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3127                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
3128                            , qs, seedB));
3129                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3130                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3131                            , seedC));
3132                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3133                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3134                    if(fresh) {
3135                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3136                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3137
3138                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3139                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3140
3141                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3142                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3143                    }
3144                }
3145                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3146                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3147
3148            }
3149            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3150                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3151                    hMod,
3152                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3153            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3154            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3155            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3156
3157            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3158                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3159                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3160                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3161                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3162                    h = heightData[x][y];
3163                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3164                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3165                        continue;
3166                    }
3167                    else
3168                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3169                    hMod = 1.0;
3170                    switch (t) {
3171                        case 0:
3172                        case 1:
3173                        case 2:
3174                        case 3:
3175                            h = 0.4;
3176                            hMod = 0.2;
3177                            break;
3178                        case 6:
3179                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3180                            break;
3181                        case 7:
3182                            h *= -0.25;
3183                            break;
3184                        case 8:
3185                            h *= -0.4;
3186                            break;
3187                        default:
3188                            h *= 0.05;
3189                    }
3190                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3191                    if (fresh) {
3192                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3193                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3194                    }
3195                }
3196            }
3197            if(fresh)
3198            {
3199                minHeat1 = ps;
3200                maxHeat1 = pc;
3201            }
3202            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3203            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3204            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3205            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3206            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3207
3208
3209            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3210                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3211                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3212                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3213                    if (fresh) {
3214                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3215                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3216                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3217                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3218                    }
3219                }
3220            }
3221            if(fresh)
3222            {
3223                minHeat = qs;
3224                maxHeat = qc;
3225                minWet = ps;
3226                maxWet = pc;
3227            }
3228            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3229        }
3230    }
3231    /**
3232     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape that resembles a
3233     * mix part-way between an ellipse and a rectangle. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3234     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3235     * distortion around all the edges than the other maps here, especially when comparing the North and South poles
3236     * with RoundSideMap.
3237     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobler_hyperelliptical_projection">Tobler hyperelliptical projection</a>.
3238     * <a href="">Example map</a>
3239     */
3240    @Beta
3241    public static class HyperellipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3242        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3243        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3244                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3245                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3246
3247        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3248        public final double[][] xPositions,
3249                yPositions,
3250                zPositions;
3251        protected final int[] edges;
3252        private final double alpha, kappa, epsilon;
3253        private final double[] Z;
3254

3260         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3261         * If you were using {@link HyperellipticalMap#HyperellipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3262         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.

3334        /**
3335         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3336         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3337         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3338         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3339         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3340         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3341         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3342         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3343         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3344         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3345         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3346         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3347         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3348         * that don't require zooming.
3349         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3350         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3351         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3352         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3353         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3354         */
3355        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier){
3356            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier, 0.0625, 2.5);
3357        }
3358
3359        /**
3360         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3361         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3362         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3363         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3364         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3365         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3366         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3367         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3368         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3369         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3370         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3371         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3372         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3373         * that don't require zooming.
3374         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3375         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3376         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3377         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3378         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3379         * @param alpha one of the Tobler parameters;  0.0625 is the default and this can range from 0.0 to 1.0 at least
3380         * @param kappa one of the Tobler parameters; 2.5 is the default but 2.0-5.0 range values are also often used
3381         */
3382        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator,
3383                                  double octaveMultiplier, double alpha, double kappa){
3384            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3385            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3386            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3387            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3388            edges = new int[height << 1];
3389            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3390            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3391            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3392            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3393            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3394            this.alpha = alpha;
3395            this.kappa = kappa;
3396            this.Z = new double[height << 2];
3397            this.epsilon = ProjectionTools.simpsonIntegrateHyperellipse(0.0, 1.0, 0.25 / height, kappa);
3398            ProjectionTools.simpsonODESolveHyperellipse(1, this.Z, 0.25 / height, alpha, kappa, epsilon);
3399        }
3400
3401        @Override
3402        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3403            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3404            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3405                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3406            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3407                return edges[y << 1];
3408            else return x;
3409        }
3410
3411        @Override
3412        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3413            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3414        }
3415
3416        /**
3417         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
3418         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
3419         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
3420         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
3421         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
3422         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
3423         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
3424         *
3425         * @param latitude  the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
3426         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
3427         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
3428         */
3429        @Override
3430        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
3431            final double z0 = Math.abs(NumberTools.sin(latitude));
3432            final int i = Arrays.binarySearch(Z, z0);
3433            final double y;
3434            if (i >= 0)
3435                y = i/(Z.length-1.);
3436            else if (-i-1 >= Z.length)
3437                y = Z[Z.length-1];
3438            else
3439                y = ((z0-Z[-i-2])/(Z[-i-1]-Z[-i-2]) + (-i-2))/(Z.length-1.);
3440            final int xx = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*Math.pow(1 - Math.pow(Math.abs(y),kappa), 1/kappa)) + 0.5);
3441            final int yy = (int)(y * Math.signum(latitude) * height * 0.5 + 0.5);
3442            return Coord.get(wrapX(xx, yy), wrapY(xx, yy));
3443        }

3445        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3446                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3447        {
3448            boolean fresh = false;
3449            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3450            {
3451                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3452                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3453                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3454                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3455                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3456                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3457                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3458                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3459                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3460                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3461                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3462                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3463                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3464                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3465                cacheA = stateA;
3466                cacheB = stateB;
3467                fresh = true;
3468            }
3469            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3470            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3471            int t;
3472
3473            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3474            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3475
3476            double p,
3477                    ps, pc,
3478                    qs, qc,
3479                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3480                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3481                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3482                    th, lon,
3483                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = Math.PI / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3484                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3485
3486            yPos = startY - ry;
3487            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3488//                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3489//                thb = asin(thy);
3490//                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3491//                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3492//                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3493//                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3494//                lat = asin(qs);
3495//
3496//                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3497
3498                lon = NumberTools.asin(Z[(int)(0.5 + Math.abs(yPos*iry)*(Z.length-1))])*Math.signum(yPos);
3499                qs = NumberTools.sin(lon);
3500                qc = NumberTools.cos(lon);
3501
3502                boolean inSpace = true;
3503                xPos = startX - hw;
3504                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3505                    //th = lon * xPos;
3506                    th = xPos * irx / Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*ProjectionTools.hyperellipse(yPos * iry, kappa));
3507                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3508                        //if(th < -2.0 || th > 2.0) {
3509                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3510                        inSpace = true;
3511                        continue;
3512                    }
3513                    if(inSpace)
3514                    {
3515                        inSpace = false;
3516                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3517                    }
3518                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3519                    th += centerLongitude;
3520                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3521                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3522                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3523                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3524                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3525                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3526                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3527                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3528                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3529                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB + seedC)
3530                            , qs, seedB));
3531                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3532                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3533                            , seedC));
3534                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3535                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3536                    if(fresh) {
3537                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3538                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3539
3540                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3541                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3542
3543                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3544                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3545                    }
3546                }
3547                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3548                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3549
3550            }
3551            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3552                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3553                    hMod,
3554                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3555            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3556            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3557            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3558
3559            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3560                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3561                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3562                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3563                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3564                    h = heightData[x][y];
3565                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3566                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3567                        continue;
3568                    }
3569                    else
3570                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3571                    hMod = 1.0;
3572                    switch (t) {
3573                        case 0:
3574                        case 1:
3575                        case 2:
3576                        case 3:
3577                            h = 0.4;
3578                            hMod = 0.2;
3579                            break;
3580                        case 6:
3581                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3582                            break;
3583                        case 7:
3584                            h *= -0.25;
3585                            break;
3586                        case 8:
3587                            h *= -0.4;
3588                            break;
3589                        default:
3590                            h *= 0.05;
3591                    }
3592                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3593                    if (fresh) {
3594                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3595                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3596                    }
3597                }
3598            }
3599            if(fresh)
3600            {
3601                minHeat1 = ps;
3602                maxHeat1 = pc;
3603            }
3604            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3605            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3606            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3607            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3608            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3609
3610
3611            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3612                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3613                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3614                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3615                    if (fresh) {
3616                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3617                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3618                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3619                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3620                    }
3621                }
3622            }
3623            if(fresh)
3624            {
3625                minHeat = qs;
3626                maxHeat = qc;
3627                minWet = ps;
3628                maxWet = pc;
3629            }
3630            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3631        }
3632    }

3634    /**
3635     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
3636     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
3637     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_projection">Hammer projection</a>, so the latitude
3638     * lines are curved instead of flat. The Mollweide projection that {@link EllipticalMap} uses has flat lines, but
3639     * the two projection are otherwise very similar, and are both equal-area (Hammer tends to have less significant
3640     * distortion around the edges, but the curvature of the latitude lines can be hard to visualize).
3641     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nmN6lMK.gifv">Preview image link of a world rotating</a>.
3642     */
3643    @Beta
3644    public static class EllipticalHammerMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3645        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3646        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3647        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3648                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3649                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3650
3651        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3652        public final double[][] xPositions,
3653                yPositions,
3654                zPositions;
3655        protected final int[] edges;
3656

3658        /**
3659         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3660         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3661         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3662         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3663         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3664         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3665         * If you were using {@link EllipticalHammerMap#EllipticalHammerMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3666         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.
3667         */
3668        public EllipticalHammerMap() {
3669            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
3670        }

3678         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and

3683         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3684         */
3685        public EllipticalHammerMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3686            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  FastNoise.instance,1.0);

3746        /**
3747         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3748         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3749         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3750         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3751         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3752         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3753         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3754         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3755         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3756         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3757         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3758         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3759         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3760         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3761         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3762         * that don't require zooming.
3763         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3764         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3765         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3766         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3767         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3768         */
3769        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3770            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3771            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3772            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3773            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3774            edges = new int[height << 1];
3775            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
3776            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3777//            terrain = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 8), terrainFreq);
3778//            terrainLayered = new Noise.Layered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 5.25);
3779            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
3780            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
3781            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
3782        }
3783
3784        @Override
3785        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3786            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3787            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3788                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3789            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3790                return edges[y << 1];
3791            else return x;
3792        }
3793
3794        @Override
3795        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3796            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3797        }
3798
3799        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3800                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3801        {
3802            boolean fresh = false;
3803            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3804            {
3805                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3806                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3807                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3808                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3809                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3810                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3811                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3812                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3813                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3814                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3815                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3816                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3817                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3818                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3819                cacheA = stateA;
3820                cacheB = stateB;
3821                fresh = true;
3822            }
3823            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3824            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3825            int t;
3826
3827            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3828            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3829
3830            double p,
3831                    ps, pc,
3832                    qs, qc,
3833                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3834                    z, th, lon, lat,
3835                    rx = width * 0.5, hw = width * 0.5, root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0),
3836                    irx = 1.0 / rx, iry = 2.0 / (double) height,
3837                    xAdj, yAdj,
3838                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)(width),
3839                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)(height);
3840
3841            yPos = (startY - height * 0.5);
3842            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3843                boolean inSpace = true;
3844                yAdj = yPos * iry;
3845                xPos = (startX - hw);
3846                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3847                    xAdj = xPos * irx;
3848                    z = Math.sqrt(1.0 - 0.5 * xAdj * xAdj - 0.5 * yAdj * yAdj);
3849                    th = z * yAdj * root2;
3850                    lon = 2.0 * NumberTools.atan2((2.0 * z * z - 1.0), (z * xAdj * root2));
3851                    if(th != th || lon < 0.0) {
3852                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3853                        inSpace = true;
3854                        continue;
3855                    }
3856                    lat = NumberTools.asin(th);
3857                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3858                    qs = th;
3859                    th = Math.PI - lon + centerLongitude;
3860                    if(inSpace)
3861                    {
3862                        inSpace = false;
3863                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3864                    }
3865                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3866                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3867                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3868                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3869                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3870                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3871                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3872                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3873                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3874                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3875                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
3876                            , qs, seedB));
3877                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3878                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3879                            , seedC));
3880                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3881                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3882                    if(fresh) {
3883                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3884                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3885
3886                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3887                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3888
3889                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3890                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3891                    }
3892                }
3893                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3894                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3895
3896            }
3897            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3898                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3899                    hMod,
3900                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3901            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3902            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3903            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3904
3905            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3906                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3907                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3908                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3909                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3910                    h = heightData[x][y];
3911                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3912                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3913                        continue;
3914                    }
3915                    else
3916                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3917                    hMod = 1.0;
3918                    switch (t) {
3919                        case 0:
3920                        case 1:
3921                        case 2:
3922                        case 3:
3923                            h = 0.4;
3924                            hMod = 0.2;
3925                            break;
3926                        case 6:
3927                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3928                            break;
3929                        case 7:
3930                            h *= -0.25;
3931                            break;
3932                        case 8:
3933                            h *= -0.4;
3934                            break;
3935                        default:
3936                            h *= 0.05;
3937                    }
3938                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3939                    if (fresh) {
3940                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3941                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3942                    }
3943                }
3944            }
3945            if(fresh)
3946            {
3947                minHeat1 = ps;
3948                maxHeat1 = pc;
3949            }
3950            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3951            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3952            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3953            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3954            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3955
3956
3957            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3958                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3959                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3960                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3961                    if (fresh) {
3962                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3963                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3964                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3965                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3966                    }
3967                }
3968            }
3969            if(fresh)
3970            {
3971                minHeat = qs;
3972                maxHeat = qc;
3973                minWet = ps;
3974                maxWet = pc;
3975            }
3976            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3977        }
3978    }
3979
3980
3981
3982    /**
3983     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
3984     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). It should
3985     * look as a world would when viewed from space, and implements rotation differently to allow the planet to be
3986     * rotated without recalculating all the data, though it cannot zoom. Note that calling
3987     * {@link #setCenterLongitude(double)} does a lot more work than in other classes, but less than fully calling
3988     * {@link #generate()} in those classes, since it doesn't remake the map data at a slightly different rotation and
3989     * instead keeps a single map in use the whole time, using sections of it. This uses an
3990     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
3991     * the latitude always at the equator; the internal map is stored as a {@link SphereMap}, which uses a
3992     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylindrical_equal-area_projection#Discussion">cylindrical equal-area
3993     * projection</a>, specifically the Smyth equal-surface projection.
3994     * <br>
3995     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WNa5nQ1.gifv">Example view of a planet rotating</a>.
3996     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/NV5IMd6.gifv">Another example</a>.
3997     */
3998    @Beta
3999    public static class RotatingSpaceMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4000        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4001                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4002                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4003
4004        public final double[][] xPositions,
4005                yPositions,
4006                zPositions;
4007        protected final int[] edges;
4008        public final SphereMap storedMap;
4009        /**
4010         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4011         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4012         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
4013         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4014         * If you were using {@link RotatingSpaceMap#RotatingSpaceMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
4015         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.
4016         */
4017        public RotatingSpaceMap() {
4018            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
4019        }
4020
4021        /**
4022         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4023         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4024         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4025         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4026         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4027         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4028         *
4029         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4030         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4031         */
4032        public RotatingSpaceMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4033            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  FastNoise.instance,1.0);
4034        }
4035
4036        /**
4037         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4038         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4039         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4040         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4041         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4042         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4043         *
4044         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4045         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4046         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4047         */
4048        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4049            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);
4050        }
4051
4052        /**
4053         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4054         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4055         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4056         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4057         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4058         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4059         *
4060         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4061         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4062         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4063         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4064         */
4065        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4066            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, octaveMultiplier);
4067        }
4068
4069        /**
4070         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4071         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4072         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4073         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4074         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4075         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4076         *
4077         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4078         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4079         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4080         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4081         */
4082        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
4083            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4084        }
4085
4086        /**
4087         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4088         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4089         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4090         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4091         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4092         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4093         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4094         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4095         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4096         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4097         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4098         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4099         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4100         * that don't require zooming.
4101         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4102         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4103         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4104         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4105         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4106         */
4107        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4108            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4109            xPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4110            yPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4111            zPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4112            edges = new int[height << 1];
4113            storedMap = new SphereMap(initialSeed, mapWidth << 1, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4114        }
4115
4116        @Override
4117        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
4118            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4119            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
4120        }
4121
4122        @Override
4123        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4124            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4125        }
4126
4127        @Override
4128        public void setCenterLongitude(double centerLongitude) {
4129            super.setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4130            int ax, ay;
4131            double
4132                    ps, pc,
4133                    qs, qc,
4134                    h, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
4135                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
4136                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
4137                    th, lon, lat, rho,
4138                    i_pi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
4139                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
4140                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
4141
4142            yPos = startY - ry;
4143            iyPos = yPos / ry;
4144            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
4145                boolean inSpace = true;
4146                xPos = startX - rx;
4147                ixPos = xPos / rx;
4148                lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
4149                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
4150                    rho = (ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
4151                    if(rho > 1.0) {
4152                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4153                        inSpace = true;
4154                        continue;
4155                    }
4156                    rho = Math.sqrt(rho);
4157                    if(inSpace)
4158                    {
4159                        inSpace = false;
4160                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4161                    }
4162                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4163                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
4164                    lon = removeExcess((centerLongitude + (NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th)))) * 0.5);
4165
4166                    qs = lat * 0.6366197723675814;
4167                    qc = qs + 1.0;
4168                    int sf = (qs >= 0.0 ? (int) qs : (int) qs - 1) & -2;
4169                    int cf = (qc >= 0.0 ? (int) qc : (int) qc - 1) & -2;
4170                    qs -= sf;
4171                    qc -= cf;
4172                    qs *= 2.0 - qs;
4173                    qc *= 2.0 - qc;
4174                    qs = qs * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qs) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4175                    qc = qc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4176
4177
4178                    ps = lon * 0.6366197723675814;
4179                    pc = ps + 1.0;
4180                    sf = (ps >= 0.0 ? (int) ps : (int) ps - 1) & -2;
4181                    cf = (pc >= 0.0 ? (int) pc : (int) pc - 1) & -2;
4182                    ps -= sf;
4183                    pc -= cf;
4184                    ps *= 2.0 - ps;
4185                    pc *= 2.0 - pc;
4186                    ps = ps * (-0.775 - 0.225 * ps) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4187                    pc = pc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * pc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4188
4189                    ax = (int)((lon * i_pi + 1.0) * width);
4190                    ay = (int)((qs + 1.0) * ry);
4191                    
4192//                    // Hammer projection, not an inverse projection like we usually use
4193//                    z = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(1 + qc * NumberTools.cos(lon * 0.5));
4194//                    ax = (int)((qc * NumberTools.sin(lon * 0.5) * z + 1.0) * width);
4195//                    ay = (int)((qs * z + 1.0) * height * 0.5);
4196
4197                    if(ax >= storedMap.width || ax < 0 || ay >= storedMap.height || ay < 0)
4198                    {
4199                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4200                        continue;
4201                    }
4202                    if(storedMap.heightCodeData[ax][ay] >= 1000) // for the seam we get when looping around
4203                    {
4204                        ay = storedMap.wrapY(ax, ay);
4205                        ax = storedMap.wrapX(ax, ay);
4206                    }
4207
4208                    xPositions[x][y] = pc * qc;
4209                    yPositions[x][y] = ps * qc;
4210                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4211
4212                    heightData[x][y] = h = storedMap.heightData[ax][ay];
4213                    heightCodeData[x][y] = codeHeight(h);
4214                    heatData[x][y] = storedMap.heatData[ax][ay];
4215                    moistureData[x][y] = storedMap.moistureData[ax][ay];
4216
4217                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4218                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4219                }
4220                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4221                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4222            }
4223
4224        }
4225
4226        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4227                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4228        {
4229            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB)// || landMod != storedMap.landModifier || coolMod != storedMap.coolingModifier)
4230            {
4231                storedMap.regenerate(0, 0, width << 1, height, landMod, heatMod, stateA, stateB);
4232                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4233                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4234
4235                minHeight = storedMap.minHeight;
4236                maxHeight = storedMap.maxHeight;
4237
4238                minHeat0 = storedMap.minHeat0;
4239                maxHeat0 = storedMap.maxHeat0;
4240
4241                minHeat1 = storedMap.minHeat1;
4242                maxHeat1 = storedMap.maxHeat1;
4243
4244                minWet0 = storedMap.minWet0;
4245                maxWet0 = storedMap.maxWet0;
4246
4247                minHeat = storedMap.minHeat;
4248                maxHeat = storedMap.maxHeat;
4249
4250                minWet = storedMap.minWet;
4251                maxWet = storedMap.maxWet;
4252
4253                cacheA = stateA;
4254                cacheB = stateB;
4255            }
4256            setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4257            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4258        }
4259    }
4260    /**
4261     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that does no projection of the map, as if the area were
4262     * completely flat or small enough that curvature is impossible to see. This also does not change heat levels at the
4263     * far north and south regions of the map, since it is meant for areas that are all about the same heat level.
4264     */
4265    public static class LocalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4266        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 3.1, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
4267        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
4268        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4269                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4270                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4271
4272        public final Noise.Ridged2D terrain, otherRidged;
4273        public final Noise.InverseLayered2D heat, moisture, terrainLayered;
4274        public final double[][] xPositions,
4275                yPositions,
4276                zPositions;

4281         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4282         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4283         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
4284         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4285         * If you were using {@link LocalMap#LocalMap(long, int, int, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4286         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, FastNoise.instance, 1.0}.

4295         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4296         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4297         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4298         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.

4303         */
4304        public LocalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4305            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  FastNoise.instance,1.0);
4306        }

4308        /**
4309         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4310         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4311         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4312         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4313         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4314         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4315         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4316         *
4317         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4318         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4319         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4320         */
4321        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4322            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, FastNoise.instance, 1.0);

4325        /**
4326         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4327         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4328         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4329         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4330         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4331         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4332         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4333         *
4334         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4335         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4336         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4337         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4338         */
4339        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {

4346         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4347         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4348         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4349         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4350         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4351         *

4353         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

4355         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4356         */
