4361        /**
4362         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4363         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4364         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4365         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4366         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4367         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4368         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4369         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4370         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4371         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4372         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4373         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4374         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4375         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4376         * that don't require zooming.
4377         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4378         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4379         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4380         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
4381         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4382         */
4383        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4384            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4385            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4386            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4387            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4388
4389            terrain = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq);
4390            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4391            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4392            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4393            otherRidged = new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq);
4394        }
4395        @Override
4396        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4397            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4398        }
4399        
4400        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4401                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4402        {
4403            boolean fresh = false;
4404            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4405            {
4406                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4407                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4408                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4409                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4410                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4411                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4412                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4413                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4414                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4415                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4416                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4417                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4418                cacheA = stateA;
4419                cacheB = stateB;
4420                fresh = true;
4421            }
4422            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4423            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4424            int t;
4425
4426            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4427            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4428
4429            double p,
4430                    ps, pc,
4431                    qs, qc,
4432                    h, temp,
4433                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
4434                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4435            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) { 
4436                xPos = startX * i_w;
4437                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4438                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
4439                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
4440                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4441                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4442                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4443                            yPos, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4444                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4445                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4446                            seedB));
4447                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4448                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4449
4450                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4451                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4452                    if(fresh) {
4453                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4454                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4455
4456                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4457                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4458
4459                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4460                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4461                    }
4462                }
4463                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4464                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4465
4466            }
4467            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4468                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4469                    hMod;
4470            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4471            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4472            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4473
4474            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4475                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4476                    h = heightData[x][y];
4477                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4478                    hMod = 1.0;
4479                    switch (t) {
4480                        case 0:
4481                        case 1:
4482                        case 2:
4483                        case 3:
4484                            h = 0.4;
4485                            hMod = 0.2;
4486                            break;
4487                        case 6:
4488                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4489                            break;
4490                        case 7:
4491                            h *= -0.25;
4492                            break;
4493                        case 8:
4494                            h *= -0.4;
4495                            break;
4496                        default:
4497                            h *= 0.05;
4498                    }
4499                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4500                    if (fresh) {
4501                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4502                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4503                    }
4504                }
4505            }
4506            if(fresh)
4507            {
4508                minHeat1 = ps;
4509                maxHeat1 = pc;
4510            }
4511            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4512            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4513            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4514            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4515            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4516
4517
4518            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4519                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4520                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4521                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4522                    if (fresh) {
4523                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4524                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4525                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4526                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4527                    }
4528                }
4529            }
4530            if(fresh)
4531            {
4532                minHeat = qs;
4533                maxHeat = qc;
4534                minWet = ps;
4535                maxWet = pc;
4536            }
4537            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4538        }
4539    }

4541    /**

4551        /**

4596         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.

4608        /**
4609         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4610         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4611         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
4612         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
4613         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
4614         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
4615         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
4616         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
4617         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
4618         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4619         *

4621         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4622         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}

4628        /**
4629         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4630         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
4631         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
4632         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
4633         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
4634         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4635         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4636         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4637         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4638         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4639         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4640         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4641         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4642         * that don't require zooming.
4643         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4644         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4645         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4646         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4647         */
4648        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4649            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4650            earth = toMimic;
4651            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
4652            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
4653            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
4654        }

4671        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4672                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4673        {
4674            boolean fresh = false;
4675            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4676            {
4677                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4678                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4679                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4680                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4681                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4682                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4683                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4684                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4685                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4686                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4687                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4688                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4689                cacheA = stateA;
4690                cacheB = stateB;
4691                fresh = true;
4692            }
4693            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4694            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4695            int t;
4696
4697            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4698            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4699
4700            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
4701
4702            if(zoom > 0)
4703            {
4704                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
4705                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
4706                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
4707                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
4708                }
4709                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
4710                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
4711            }
4712            else
4713            {
4714                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
4715                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
4716            }
4717            double p,
4718                    ps, pc,
4719                    qs, qc,
4720                    h, temp,
4721                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
4722                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4723            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4724                xPos = startX * i_w;
4725                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4726                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
4727                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
4728                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4729
4730                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
4731                    {
4732                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4733                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4734                                yPos, seedA)) * 0.85;
4735                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
4736                            h += 0.05;
4737                        else
4738                            h += 0.15;
4739                    }
4740                    else
4741                    {
4742                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4743                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4744                                yPos, seedA)) * -0.9;
4745                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
4746                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
4747                        else
4748                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
4749                    }
4750                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
4751                    heightData[x][y] = h;
4752                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4753                                    + otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4754                            seedB));
4755                    temp = otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4756                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4757
4758                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4759                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4760                    if(fresh) {
4761                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4762                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4763
4764                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4765                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4766
4767                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4768                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4769                    }
4770                }
4771                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4772                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4773
4774            }
4775            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4776                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4777                    hMod;
4778            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4779            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4780            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4781
4782            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4783                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4784                    h = heightData[x][y];
4785                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4786                    hMod = 1.0;
4787                    switch (t) {
4788                        case 0:
4789                        case 1:
4790                        case 2:
4791                        case 3:
4792                            h = 0.4;
4793                            hMod = 0.2;
4794                            break;
4795                        case 6:
4796                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4797                            break;
4798                        case 7:
4799                            h *= -0.25;
4800                            break;
4801                        case 8:
4802                            h *= -0.4;
4803                            break;
4804                        default:
4805                            h *= 0.05;
4806                    }
4807                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4808                    if (fresh) {
4809                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4810                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4811                    }
4812                }
4813            }
4814            if(fresh)
4815            {
4816                minHeat1 = ps;
4817                maxHeat1 = pc;
4818            }
4819            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4820            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4821            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4822            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4823            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4824
4825
4826            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4827                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4828                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4829                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4830                    if (fresh) {
4831                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4832                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4833                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4834                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4835                    }
4836                }
4837            }
4838            if(fresh)
4839            {
4840                minHeat = qs;
4841                maxHeat = qc;
4842                minWet = ps;
4843                maxWet = pc;
4844            }
4845            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4846        }
4847    }
